data.title: Home Renovation Costs
data.statement:
You are planning some home renovations, including upgrading some walls and/or floors.

Calculate the [[totalCost]]



<<NOTES:>>

Assume all rooms are rectangular.

You will have to calculate floor area and walls area: floor area is straightforward, but for walls you should make the following assumptions:
‣ You are doing all 4 walls.
‣ <<10%>> of the walls <<aren't>> actually walls (because they're windows or doors, which will not be renovated/upgraded).

testCases.title: Test 3 - floor and walls (1 each)
testCases.testIn:
7.5 feet tall
2
living-room floor 14x19 $17.50
library walls 27x6 $2.50

data.constraints: The measurement unit of all dimensions is feet (i.e., everything is in feet)
data.stubGenerator:
read infoAboutHeight:string(20)
read numOfRenos:int
loop numOfRenos read Renovation:string(100)
write $totalCost
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string, info about height of all rooms, in the format of the [[height]] (a double) followed by {{ feet tall}}

<<Line 2:>> An integer, number of Renovations [[numRenos]] to follow

<<Next [[numRenos]] Lines:>> A string describing the Renovation, consisting of:
a String, the one-word name of the room
followed by either {{floor}} or {{walls}} to indicate what you are remodeling
followed by the floor dimensions, in the format of an integer {{x}} another integer
followed by a double, the cost-per-square-foot of the materials needed (always prefixed with {{$}})
data.outputDescription: [[totalCost]], shown as American money (specifically shown to 2 decimal places, and with {{$}} and commas for thousands separators as needed)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are planning some home renovations, including upgrading some walls and/or floors.

Calculate the totalCost



NOTES:

Assume all rooms are rectangular.

You will have to calculate floor area and walls area: floor area is straightforward, but for walls you should make the following assumptions:
‣ You are doing all 4 walls.
‣ 10% of the walls aren't actually walls (because they're windows or doors, which will not be renovated/upgraded).
Input
Line 1: A string, info about height of all rooms, in the format of the height (a double) followed by feet tall

Line 2: An integer, number of Renovations numRenos to follow

Next numRenos Lines: A string describing the Renovation, consisting of:
a String, the one-word name of the room
followed by either floor or walls to indicate what you are remodeling
followed by the floor dimensions, in the format of an integer x another integer
followed by a double, the cost-per-square-foot of the materials needed (always prefixed with $)
Output
totalCost, shown as American money (specifically shown to 2 decimal places, and with $ and commas for thousands separators as needed)
Constraints
The measurement unit of all dimensions is feet (i.e., everything is in feet)
Example
Input
8.5 feet tall
1
kitchen floor 21x9 $17.00
Output
$3,213.00
